response_parsed.title: Profiling REST APIs using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to profile the performance of your REST APIs built with FastAPI using Python 3.12+. By profiling, we mean understanding and optimizing the execution time and resource usage of each API endpoint.
key_points: Create a FastAPI application with your desired endpoints
Enable profiling for specific or all endpoints using the ProfiledFastAPI class from fastapi-profiling
Run your FastAPI app using Uvicorn with the `--reload`, `--profile` and `--host` flags
Access profiles data via API response or in a dedicated Profiles endpoint
Analyze and optimize performance based on the generated profiling data
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this implementation
FastAPI >= 0.75.0, uvicorn >= 0.18.0 and fastapi-profiling >= 0.6.0 are recommended
caveats: Profiling can impact the performance of your API due to the additional overhead introduced by the profiler
It's essential to analyze the generated data and make informed decisions to optimize your application without negatively impacting user experience
